Ariyalur.name: Ariyalur
Ariyalur.description: Known for its cement industries and rich fossil deposits.

heritagePlaces.name: Gangaikonda Cholapuram
heritagePlaces.description: A UNESCO World Heritage Site built by Rajendra Chola I, renowned for its grand architecture and intricate sculptures.
heritagePlaces.story: Constructed in the 11th century by Rajendra Chola I to commemorate his victorious expedition to the Ganges, this temple stands as a testament to Chola architectural brilliance.

heritagePlaces.name: Thirumazhapadi Vaidyanathaswami Temple
heritagePlaces.description: A Paadal Petra Sthalam dedicated to Lord Shiva, known for its annual Nandi Kalyanam festival.
heritagePlaces.story: This ancient temple, celebrated in Tamil Saivite hymns, hosts the unique Nandi Kalyanam festival, symbolizing the celestial wedding of Nandi.

heritagePlaces.name: Vajrathampanathar Temple
heritagePlaces.description: An ancient temple showcasing Chola architecture and inscriptions from multiple dynasties.
heritagePlaces.story: Built during the reign of Sundara Chola in 962 AD, this temple houses over forty inscriptions from the Chola, Pandya, and Hoysala periods.

heritagePlaces.name: Elakurichi Adaikala Madha Shrine
heritagePlaces.description: A renowned Catholic pilgrimage center established by missionary Constanzo Beschi.
heritagePlaces.story: Founded by Italian Jesuit missionary Constanzo Beschi, also known as Veeramamunivar, this shrine is a significant site for Christian pilgrims.

heritagePlaces.name: Jayankondam Varadharaja Perumal Temple
heritagePlaces.description: A Divya Desam temple dedicated to Lord Vishnu, revered in Vaishnavite traditions.
heritagePlaces.story: This temple is one of the 108 Divya Desams, sacred abodes of Vishnu, and holds immense spiritual significance for devotees.

heritagePlaces.name: Alanduraiyar Temple
heritagePlaces.description: An ancient Shiva temple associated with the 7th-century saint Thirugnanasambandar.
heritagePlaces.story: Believed to be worshipped by Parasurama, this temple was originally built in brick and later reconstructed in stone during the Chola period.

heritagePlaces.name: Kodandaramaswamy Temple
heritagePlaces.description: A Vishnu temple featuring idols of Rama, Sita, and Lakshmana.
heritagePlaces.story: Constructed by a Palubettaraiyar chieftain in the 17th century, this temple is a significant site for devotees of Lord Rama.

heritagePlaces.name: Ganga Jadadisvarar Temple
heritagePlaces.description: A temple dedicated to Lord Shiva, praised in Devaram hymns by saints Appar and Sambandar.
heritagePlaces.story: Built by Uttama Chola's officer in 980 AD, this temple is located in Govindaputtur and is known for its Dravidian architecture.

heritagePlaces.name: Fossil Museum
heritagePlaces.description: A museum showcasing fossils from the Cretaceous period, including dinosaur eggs and marine fossils.
heritagePlaces.story: Ariyalur's rich fossil heritage, including dinosaur and ammonite fossils, is preserved in this museum, attracting researchers and tourists alike.

Chengalpattu.name: Chengalpattu
Chengalpattu.description: Famous for its historical temples and proximity to Chennai.

heritagePlaces.name: Arjuna's Penance
heritagePlaces.description: A massive open-air rock relief depicting scenes from Hindu mythology.
heritagePlaces.story: Carved during the Pallava period, this bas-relief illustrates either Arjuna's penance to obtain Shiva's weapon or Bhagiratha's penance to bring the Ganges to earth.

heritagePlaces.name: Pancha Rathas
heritagePlaces.description: Five monolithic rock-cut temples, each carved in the shape of a chariot.
heritagePlaces.story: Attributed to the reign of King Narasimhavarman I, these structures are exemplary of Dravidian architecture and are part of the UNESCO World Heritage Site at Mahabalipuram.

heritagePlaces.name: Shore Temple
heritagePlaces.description: A structural temple built with blocks of granite, overlooking the Bay of Bengal.
heritagePlaces.story: Constructed during the reign of Narasimhavarman II, it's one of the oldest structural stone temples in South India and part of the Mahabalipuram UNESCO World Heritage Site.

heritagePlaces.name: Ganesh Ratha
heritagePlaces.description: A monolithic temple dedicated to Lord Ganesha.
heritagePlaces.story: Originally dedicated to Shiva, it was later converted to a Ganesha temple. The structure showcases the evolution of Dravidian temple architecture.

heritagePlaces.name: Varaha Cave Temple
heritagePlaces.description: A rock-cut cave temple featuring depictions of Vishnu's Varaha avatar.
heritagePlaces.story: This temple houses intricate bas-reliefs, including the depiction of Varaha rescuing Bhudevi, exemplifying Pallava artistry.

heritagePlaces.name: Krishna Mandapam
heritagePlaces.description: A rock-cut cave temple depicting Lord Krishna lifting Govardhan Hill.
heritagePlaces.story: The relief showcases Krishna protecting villagers from torrential rains, highlighting themes of divine intervention and protection.

heritagePlaces.name: Mahabalipuram Lighthouse
heritagePlaces.description: A lighthouse built in 1900, adjacent to ancient Pallava-era structures.
heritagePlaces.story: Standing beside an older lighthouse built by the Pallavas, it represents the continuity of maritime navigation aids in the region.

heritagePlaces.name: Olakkanesvara Temple
heritagePlaces.description: A structural temple dedicated to Lord Shiva, located atop a hillock.
heritagePlaces.story: Also known as the Old Lighthouse, it served both religious and navigational purposes during the Pallava period.

heritagePlaces.name: Tiger Cave
heritagePlaces.description: A rock-cut shrine adorned with tiger head carvings.
heritagePlaces.story: Believed to have been a royal retreat or a venue for cultural performances during the Pallava era.

heritagePlaces.name: DakshinaChitra
heritagePlaces.description: A living-history museum preserving South Indian heritage, arts, and culture.
heritagePlaces.story: Established in 1996, this open-air museum houses traditional homes from Tamil Nadu, Kerala, Karnataka, and Andhra Pradesh and showcases rural life, craft, and tradition.

Chennai.name: Chennai
Chennai.description: The capital city of Tamil Nadu, known for its cultural heritage, beaches, and historical monuments.

heritagePlaces.name: Fort St. George
heritagePlaces.description: The first English fortress in India, established in 1644.
heritagePlaces.story: Built by the British East India Company, Fort St. George marked the beginning of modern Chennai. It now houses the Tamil Nadu Legislative Assembly and Secretariat.

heritagePlaces.name: Kapaleeshwarar Temple
heritagePlaces.description: A historic Hindu temple dedicated to Lord Shiva, located in Mylapore.
heritagePlaces.story: This 7th-century temple built in Dravidian style is a cultural and spiritual landmark of Chennai, believed to be originally built by the Pallavas and later rebuilt by the Vijayanagara kings.

heritagePlaces.name: Parthasarathy Temple
heritagePlaces.description: A 6th-century temple dedicated to Lord Krishna in Triplicane.
heritagePlaces.story: Built by the Pallavas and later renovated by the Cholas and Vijayanagar rulers, the temple is unique for housing all five forms of Krishna.

heritagePlaces.name: San Thome Basilica
heritagePlaces.description: A Roman Catholic minor basilica built over the tomb of St. Thomas the Apostle.
heritagePlaces.story: This neo-Gothic church, rebuilt in 1896, stands at the site believed to be the burial place of St. Thomas, one of the twelve apostles of Jesus.

heritagePlaces.name: Government Museum
heritagePlaces.description: One of the oldest museums in India, located in Egmore.
heritagePlaces.story: Established in 1851, it features rare artifacts including archaeological and numismatic collections, and houses the Connemara Public Library.

heritagePlaces.name: Valluvar Kottam
heritagePlaces.description: A monument dedicated to Tamil poet and philosopher Thiruvalluvar.
heritagePlaces.story: Built in 1976, the monument honors Thiruvalluvar, author of the Thirukkural. Its auditorium is one of the largest in Asia.

heritagePlaces.name: Vivekananda House
heritagePlaces.description: Historical building where Swami Vivekananda stayed in 1897.
heritagePlaces.story: Originally called Ice House, it was renamed to honor Swami Vivekananda. Now it serves as a cultural center displaying his works and teachings.

heritagePlaces.name: Royapuram Railway Station
heritagePlaces.description: Oldest surviving railway station in India.
heritagePlaces.story: Inaugurated in 1856, Royapuram marks the birthplace of railway services in South India. It continues to function as an active station.

heritagePlaces.name: Marina Beach
heritagePlaces.description: India's longest natural urban beach, rich in colonial and cultural history.
heritagePlaces.story: Developed during the British Raj, the beach is flanked by historic buildings like the University of Madras, Senate House, and memorials of key Tamil leaders.

heritagePlaces.name: Theosophical Society
heritagePlaces.description: A spiritual and philosophical organization founded in 1875.
heritagePlaces.story: Its headquarters in Adyar spreads across 260 acres, featuring diverse shrines and the historic 450-year-old banyan tree.

heritagePlaces.name: Basilica of Our Lady of Good Health
heritagePlaces.description: A Roman Catholic church in Velankanni, Chennai, known for its historical and religious significance.
heritagePlaces.story: Built in the 16th century, it is a pilgrimage site dedicated to the Virgin Mary. It is one of the oldest and most prominent churches in India.

Coimbatore.name: Coimbatore
Coimbatore.description: Known as the 'Manchester of South India', famous for its textile industry and surrounded by the Western Ghats.

heritagePlaces.name: Marudamalai Temple
heritagePlaces.description: A popular hilltop Hindu temple dedicated to Lord Murugan.
heritagePlaces.story: Located on a hill, the Marudamalai temple is known for its scenic surroundings and architectural beauty. It is one of the most visited temples in Tamil Nadu.

heritagePlaces.name: Perur Pateeswarar Temple
heritagePlaces.description: A prominent ancient temple dedicated to Lord Shiva.
heritagePlaces.story: Built by the Chola kings, this temple is famous for its magnificent sculptures and historical significance, attracting pilgrims from all over the region.

heritagePlaces.name: Tidel Park
heritagePlaces.description: A modern IT park and a notable commercial landmark in Coimbatore.
heritagePlaces.story: Tidel Park is a major commercial landmark in Coimbatore, hosting several tech companies and fostering the city's growth as a tech hub.

heritagePlaces.name: Kovai Kutralam
heritagePlaces.description: A beautiful waterfall located in the Western Ghats.
heritagePlaces.story: Known for its natural beauty and serene surroundings, Kovai Kutralam is a favorite among tourists seeking a peaceful getaway.

heritagePlaces.name: Sree Durga Bhuwaneswari Temple
heritagePlaces.description: A famous temple dedicated to Goddess Durga.
heritagePlaces.story: This temple is known for its spiritual significance and vibrant celebrations of festivals like Navaratri, attracting devotees from all over.

heritagePlaces.name: Gass Forest Museum
heritagePlaces.description: A museum dedicated to the conservation of forests and wildlife.
heritagePlaces.story: Established in 1902, the museum is known for its rare exhibits on forest ecology, plants, and animals of the region, promoting conservation awareness.

heritagePlaces.name: Brookefields Mall
heritagePlaces.description: One of the largest and most popular shopping malls in Coimbatore.
heritagePlaces.story: Opened in 2009, Brookefields is known for its modern facilities and diverse range of stores, making it a popular destination for both locals and tourists.

heritagePlaces.name: Bhimavaram Temple
heritagePlaces.description: A revered Hindu temple dedicated to Lord Shiva.
heritagePlaces.story: The Bhimavaram Temple, believed to have been built during the Chola dynasty, is known for its serene environment and historic religious significance.

heritagePlaces.name: Ranganathaswamy Temple
heritagePlaces.description: A sacred temple dedicated to Lord Vishnu.
heritagePlaces.story: Located in a beautiful environment, the Ranganathaswamy Temple is an important religious landmark and has ancient inscriptions on its walls.

heritagePlaces.name: Bhavani Sagar Dam
heritagePlaces.description: A major reservoir and dam located on the Bhavani River.
heritagePlaces.story: Built in the 1950s, the Bhavani Sagar Dam is a major source of water for Coimbatore and plays a crucial role in irrigation and flood control.

Cuddalore.name: Cuddalore
Cuddalore.description: A coastal district with beautiful beaches and historical significance.

heritagePlaces.name: Saint's Church
heritagePlaces.description: An ancient church with a rich colonial history.
heritagePlaces.story: Built during the British colonial era, the church is known for its beautiful architecture and its historical importance as a place of worship for the early Christian settlers.

heritagePlaces.name: Pitchavaram Mangrove Forest
heritagePlaces.description: One of the largest mangrove forests in India.
heritagePlaces.story: Pitchavaram is famous for its natural beauty and biodiversity. The mangrove ecosystem is a critical habitat for various species of birds, fish, and other wildlife.

heritagePlaces.name: Kattumannar Koil
heritagePlaces.description: An ancient Hindu temple dedicated to Lord Shiva.
heritagePlaces.story: The Kattumannar Koil temple, built by the Chola dynasty, is known for its stunning architecture and carvings, making it an important religious and historical landmark in the region.

heritagePlaces.name: Cuddalore Beach
heritagePlaces.description: A serene and less-crowded beach with historical significance.
heritagePlaces.story: Cuddalore Beach offers a peaceful environment for visitors and has been a historical site for the British colonial era, where trade and transport took place.

heritagePlaces.name: Nataraja Temple
heritagePlaces.description: An ancient temple dedicated to Lord Shiva in his cosmic dance form.
heritagePlaces.story: The Nataraja Temple is one of the oldest in the region, known for its intricate carvings and the artistic depiction of Lord Shiva performing the cosmic dance.

heritagePlaces.name: Sankara Puram Temple
heritagePlaces.description: A famous Hindu temple dedicated to Lord Vishnu.
heritagePlaces.story: Located near the village of Sankara Puram, this temple is renowned for its tranquil environment and devotion to Lord Vishnu, attracting pilgrims from nearby regions.

heritagePlaces.name: Vadakkal Municipal Park
heritagePlaces.description: A popular public park with historical elements.
heritagePlaces.story: Vadakkal Park is a place where locals come to relax and enjoy nature. The park has historical elements related to the town's early colonial development.

heritagePlaces.name: Vivekananda House
heritagePlaces.description: A house dedicated to the memory of Swami Vivekananda.
heritagePlaces.story: This historical house is associated with Swami Vivekananda's visit to Cuddalore. It serves as a cultural center promoting his teachings and philosophies.

heritagePlaces.name: Sri Kothandaramar Temple
heritagePlaces.description: A temple dedicated to Lord Rama located in the Cuddalore district.
heritagePlaces.story: This temple is famous for its architectural beauty and its deep religious significance to the local devotees of Lord Rama.

heritagePlaces.name: Annu Aruvi Waterfalls
heritagePlaces.description: A scenic waterfall located in the Cuddalore district.
heritagePlaces.story: The waterfall is a beautiful natural formation, drawing nature lovers and photographers alike. It's a popular spot during the monsoon season.

Dharmapuri.name: Dharmapuri
Dharmapuri.description: Known for its mango cultivation and scenic hills.

heritagePlaces.name: Banana Plantation
heritagePlaces.description: Famous for its vast banana plantations and agriculture.
heritagePlaces.story: Dharmapuri is renowned for its extensive banana plantations that have been a major contributor to the region's economy. The fertile soil and climate make it ideal for banana cultivation.

heritagePlaces.name: Hogenakkal Waterfalls
heritagePlaces.description: A beautiful waterfall on the Kaveri River, often referred to as the 'Niagara of India.'
heritagePlaces.story: Hogenakkal is famous for its scenic beauty and medicinal baths. The falls are a popular tourist spot, especially known for its boat rides and stunning landscape.

heritagePlaces.name: Murugan Temple
heritagePlaces.description: A temple dedicated to Lord Murugan, situated in the hills.
heritagePlaces.story: This ancient temple has been a place of worship for devotees of Lord Murugan for centuries, known for its stunning location and spiritual significance.

heritagePlaces.name: Kottai Amma Temple
heritagePlaces.description: A revered Hindu temple dedicated to the goddess Kottai Amma.
heritagePlaces.story: The temple is an important religious site for the people of Dharmapuri and attracts numerous devotees annually during festivals.

heritagePlaces.name: Sri Ramanashram
heritagePlaces.description: An ashram associated with the famous spiritual leader Sri Ramana Maharshi.
heritagePlaces.story: The ashram, located near the holy mountain of Arunachala, is a place of meditation and spiritual awakening for people from all over the world.

heritagePlaces.name: Arjuna Pillar
heritagePlaces.description: An ancient stone pillar with historical significance.
heritagePlaces.story: The Arjuna Pillar is believed to be a memorial dedicated to the ancient ruler Arjuna and stands as a testament to the area's rich heritage and history.

heritagePlaces.name: Sri Durga Temple
heritagePlaces.description: A historic temple dedicated to Goddess Durga.
heritagePlaces.story: This ancient temple is one of the main religious landmarks in Dharmapuri, attracting pilgrims from across the region for its annual festivals.

heritagePlaces.name: Sri Venkateswara Temple
heritagePlaces.description: A temple dedicated to Lord Venkateswara located in the heart of the city.
heritagePlaces.story: The temple is an important religious center for the locals and is known for its unique architectural style and cultural significance.

heritagePlaces.name: Penagonda Fort
heritagePlaces.description: A historic fort located in the Penagonda region of Dharmapuri.
heritagePlaces.story: The fort was built during the Vijayanagara period and served as a strategic defense point in the region. It now stands as a symbol of the historical grandeur of the area.

heritagePlaces.name: Sri Ankalamman Temple
heritagePlaces.description: A significant temple dedicated to Goddess Ankalamman.
heritagePlaces.story: This ancient temple is considered a sacred place by the local community and is renowned for its traditional rituals and the annual festival it hosts.

Dindigul.name: Dindigul
Dindigul.description: Famous for its locks, biryani, and the Dindigul Fort.

heritagePlaces.name: Dindigul Fort
heritagePlaces.description: A historic fort located on a hilltop with panoramic views of the surrounding landscape.
heritagePlaces.story: The Dindigul Fort has a rich history, with origins dating back to the 17th century, and has been under various rulers, including the Pandyas, Nayaks, and the British.

heritagePlaces.name: Sri Kottai Mariamman Temple
heritagePlaces.description: A famous Hindu temple dedicated to the goddess Mariamman, located in the heart of the city.
heritagePlaces.story: This temple is an important religious site, and it hosts the annual Mariamman festival, attracting thousands of devotees.

heritagePlaces.name: Idaikkal Temple
heritagePlaces.description: A historical temple dedicated to Lord Murugan, located on a hill.
heritagePlaces.story: This temple is situated on a hill and offers breathtaking views of the surrounding landscape. It is an important spiritual center for the region.

heritagePlaces.name: Thadiyan Kottai
heritagePlaces.description: A historic fort and military base built during the Vijayanagara period.
heritagePlaces.story: The Thadiyan Kottai served as an important military stronghold and is a fine example of Vijayanagara architecture.

heritagePlaces.name: Palani Hills Temple
heritagePlaces.description: A renowned temple dedicated to Lord Murugan, located atop the Palani hills.
heritagePlaces.story: The Palani Hills Temple is one of the six abodes of Lord Murugan, attracting millions of pilgrims every year. The temple is known for its spiritual significance and historical value.

heritagePlaces.name: Sri Arulmigu Dhandayuthapani Temple
heritagePlaces.description: A temple dedicated to Lord Murugan, located at the foothills of the Palani mountains.
heritagePlaces.story: This temple is one of the significant Murugan temples in South India, with a rich history of worship and spiritual importance.

heritagePlaces.name: Vandiyur Murugan Temple
heritagePlaces.description: A historic temple dedicated to Lord Murugan, located near Vandiyur Lake.
heritagePlaces.story: This temple is one of the prominent Murugan shrines in the region and is a part of the famous pilgrimage circuit in Tamil Nadu.

heritagePlaces.name: Thoppur Hills
heritagePlaces.description: A beautiful hill station known for its serene landscape and views.
heritagePlaces.story: The Thoppur Hills are famous for their natural beauty and are a popular tourist destination for those seeking peace and tranquility.

heritagePlaces.name: Bodhi Tree
heritagePlaces.description: An ancient tree believed to have spiritual significance.
heritagePlaces.story: The Bodhi tree in Dindigul is considered sacred, as it symbolizes enlightenment and has cultural importance in the region.

heritagePlaces.name: Sri Ganapathi Temple
heritagePlaces.description: A prominent temple dedicated to Lord Ganesha.
heritagePlaces.story: The temple is a vital religious landmark in Dindigul and hosts major festivals like Ganesh Chaturthi, attracting large crowds of devotees.

Erode.name: Erode
Erode.description: Known as the 'Turmeric City' for its turmeric trade.

heritagePlaces.name: Brookefields Mall
heritagePlaces.description: One of the largest malls in Erode, offering a modern shopping experience.
heritagePlaces.story: Brookefields Mall is a symbol of modern retail in Erode, providing a variety of shops, eateries, and entertainment options.

heritagePlaces.name: Akkarayampalayam Temple
heritagePlaces.description: A historical Hindu temple dedicated to Lord Shiva.
heritagePlaces.story: The Akkarayampalayam Temple is an ancient spiritual site where devotees come to worship Lord Shiva. It is known for its peaceful atmosphere and cultural significance.

heritagePlaces.name: Vellode Bird Sanctuary
heritagePlaces.description: A well-known bird sanctuary attracting migratory birds.
heritagePlaces.story: Vellode Bird Sanctuary is an important wildlife site in Erode, home to various migratory and native birds. It is a haven for birdwatchers and nature lovers.

heritagePlaces.name: Kavundapalayam Temple
heritagePlaces.description: A popular temple dedicated to Lord Murugan in the Erode region.
heritagePlaces.story: The Kavundapalayam Temple is renowned for its religious importance and festivals that attract a large number of devotees every year.

heritagePlaces.name: Thindal Temple
heritagePlaces.description: A prominent Lord Murugan temple situated on a hill in Erode.
heritagePlaces.story: Thindal Temple is a famous pilgrimage site, offering beautiful views from its hilltop location. The temple is known for its spiritual and historical importance.

heritagePlaces.name: Periyar Historic Park
heritagePlaces.description: A lush green park that commemorates the legacy of social reformer Periyar E. V. Ramasamy.
heritagePlaces.story: Periyar Historic Park in Erode serves as a tribute to the great reformer and is known for its well-maintained gardens and memorial structures.

heritagePlaces.name: Mettur Dam
heritagePlaces.description: One of the largest dams in India, located on the Kaveri River.
heritagePlaces.story: Mettur Dam, completed in 1934, plays a crucial role in irrigation and hydroelectric power generation. It has historical and engineering significance.

heritagePlaces.name: Elappalayam Temple
heritagePlaces.description: A famous temple dedicated to Lord Shiva, located in a quiet rural area.
heritagePlaces.story: The Elappalayam Temple is known for its peaceful ambiance and is a place where devotees gather to worship Lord Shiva. It holds cultural and spiritual significance.

heritagePlaces.name: Amaravathi Temple
heritagePlaces.description: A historical temple dedicated to Lord Shiva, known for its architectural beauty.
heritagePlaces.story: The Amaravathi Temple is an ancient site, featuring Dravidian architectural styles and rich cultural history.

heritagePlaces.name: Sri Kottai Mariamman Temple
heritagePlaces.description: A famous temple dedicated to Mariamman, the goddess of rain and fertility.
heritagePlaces.story: This temple is one of the oldest in Erode and attracts thousands of devotees, especially during the annual festival.

Kallakurichi.name: Kallakurichi
Kallakurichi.description: A newly formed district with agricultural prominence.

Kancheepuram.name: Kancheepuram
Kancheepuram.description: The 'City of Thousand Temples' and famous for its handwoven silk sarees.

Karur.name: Karur
Karur.description: Known for its textile industries and ancient temples.

Krishnagiri.name: Krishnagiri
Krishnagiri.description: Famous for mangoes and the Krishnagiri Dam.

Madurai.name: Madurai
Madurai.description: One of the oldest continuously inhabited cities in the world, home to the magnificent Meenakshi Amman Temple.

heritagePlaces.name: Meenakshi Amman Temple
heritagePlaces.description: Iconic temple dedicated to Goddess Meenakshi
heritagePlaces.story: This historic temple complex spans 14 acres with 14 magnificent gopurams.

heritagePlaces.name: Thirumalai Nayak Palace
heritagePlaces.description: 17th century palace with Indo-Saracenic architecture
heritagePlaces.story: Built by King Thirumalai Nayak in 1636, this palace showcases the grandeur of the Nayak dynasty.

heritagePlaces.name: Gandhi Memorial Museum
heritagePlaces.description: Museum dedicated to Mahatma Gandhi
heritagePlaces.story: Housed in the historic Tamukkam Palace, it contains relics from India's freedom struggle.

heritagePlaces.name: Koodal Azhagar Temple
heritagePlaces.description: Ancient Vishnu temple
heritagePlaces.story: One of the 108 Divya Desams, this temple dates back to the Pandya period.

heritagePlaces.name: Alagar Kovil
heritagePlaces.description: Hill temple dedicated to Lord Vishnu
heritagePlaces.story: This ancient temple is mentioned in Tamil Sangam literature and hosts the famous Chithirai festival.

Mayiladuthurai.name: Mayiladuthurai
Mayiladuthurai.description: A temple town with rich cultural heritage.

Nagapattinam.name: Nagapattinam
Nagapattinam.description: A coastal district known for its fishing harbors and religious sites.

Namakkal.name: Namakkal
Namakkal.description: Famous for poultry farming and the Namakkal Fort.

Nilgiris.name: Nilgiris
Nilgiris.description: A picturesque hill district with tea plantations and wildlife.

Perambalur.name: Perambalur
Perambalur.description: Known for its limestone deposits and historical sites.

Pudukkottai.name: Pudukkottai
Pudukkottai.description: Rich in archaeological sites and ancient temples.

Ramanathapuram.name: Ramanathapuram
Ramanathapuram.description: Home to the famous Rameswaram Temple and Pamban Bridge.

Ranipet.name: Ranipet
Ranipet.description: Known for its leather industries and historical forts.

Salem.name: Salem
Salem.description: Known for its rich history, mango cultivation, and the steel industry.

Sivaganga.name: Sivaganga
Sivaganga.description: A district with historical palaces and religious sites.

Tenkasi.name: Tenkasi
Tenkasi.description: Famous for the Courtallam waterfalls and temples.

Thanjavur.name: Thanjavur
Thanjavur.description: The cultural capital of Tamil Nadu, home to the UNESCO World Heritage Site Brihadeeswarar Temple.

Theni.name: Theni
Theni.description: Known for its agricultural farms and scenic beauty.

Thoothukudi.name: Thoothukudi
Thoothukudi.description: A major port city famous for pearl fishing and salt production.

Tiruchirappalli.name: Tiruchirappalli
Tiruchirappalli.description: Home to the famous Rock Fort Temple and Srirangam temple, a major pilgrimage center.

heritagePlaces.name: Srirangam Ranganathaswamy Temple
heritagePlaces.description: Largest functioning Hindu temple in the world
heritagePlaces.story: This temple complex covers 156 acres and is one of the most important Vishnu temples.

heritagePlaces.name: Rockfort Temple
heritagePlaces.description: Ancient temple on a massive rock
heritagePlaces.story: This 83m tall rock has been a fortress since ancient times, with temples built by the Pallavas.

heritagePlaces.name: Jambukeswarar Temple
heritagePlaces.description: One of the five Pancha Bhoota Stalas
heritagePlaces.story: This temple represents the element of water and has an underground water stream.

heritagePlaces.name: Kallanai Dam
heritagePlaces.description: One of the oldest water-diversion structures in the world
heritagePlaces.story: Built by the Chola king Karikalan around 2nd century CE, it's still in use today.

heritagePlaces.name: St. Joseph's College
heritagePlaces.description: Historic educational institution
heritagePlaces.story: Founded in 1844 by French missionaries, it's one of the oldest colleges in India.

Tirunelveli.name: Tirunelveli
Tirunelveli.description: Famous for its unique cuisine including 'Tirunelveli Halwa' and ancient temples.

Tirupathur.name: Tirupathur
Tirupathur.description: A district with historical temples and forts.

Tiruppur.name: Tiruppur
Tiruppur.description: Known as the 'Knit Wear Capital' of India for its textile manufacturing.

Tiruvallur.name: Tiruvallur
Tiruvallur.description: Known for its temples and proximity to Chennai.

Tiruvannamalai.name: Tiruvannamalai
Tiruvannamalai.description: Famous for the Arunachaleswarar Temple and spiritual significance.

Vellore.name: Vellore
Vellore.description: Known for its grand Vellore Fort and prestigious educational institutions.

Viluppuram.name: Viluppuram
Viluppuram.description: A district with historical temples and scenic landscapes.

Virudhunagar.name: Virudhunagar
